If, therefore, by this property water is not considered a pollutant, CO2 then cannot be considered a pollutant either.<br />\n<br />\nCarbon Dioxide cannot intoxicate because it is a non-poisonous non-toxic substance. Carbon Dioxide does not intoxicate \u2014 it suffocates--just like life sustaining water.<br />\n<br />\nCO2 cannot be considered a pollutant merely because it asphyxiates.<br />\n<br />\nGreedy Jews have tried to tag CO2 as a pollutant simply because it is a product of fossil fuel combustion. However, CO2 is also a product of respiration, fermentation and putrefaction.<br />\n<br />\nIn any case, the CO2 released by combustion of fossil fuels had previously been taken from the atmosphere by photosynthetic organisms and converted into organic compounds to be used in their metabolic functions as structures for reproduction, etc. When those photosynthetic organisms later died, their remains were subjected to strong geological processes that convert organic matter into oil, coal and methane.<br />\n<br />\nThose products are the fossil fuels that we use today to power our industries and vehicles; therefore, we are only returning CO2 to the place it once occupied during the Carboniferous Period.<br />\n<br />\nCO2 cannot then be considered a pollutant just because it is released back into the atmosphere by combustion of organic fuels and from many other natural processes unrelated with life.<br />\n<br />\nWe heard ignoramus Al Fuckin\u2019 Gore warning the world about arctic ice cap melting due to MAN MADE Carbon Dioxide.<br />\n<br />\nIf so, why is Antartic ice building up ? Just shows how stupid this Nobel prize winner is .<br />\n<br />\nArctic ice can melt only due to METHANE and it is happening right now<br />\n<br />\nOceans are a CO2 sink-- warming of ocean waters release CO2 --not vice versa . Cold water can be charged with more CO2 gas for a drinking soda. CO2 does NOT cause global warming as the oceans act as a sink. Colder oceans absorb more CO2.<br />\n<br />\nCarbon dioxide is an integral part of the carbon cycle, a biogeochemical cycle in which carbon is exchanged between the Earth's oceans, soil, rocks and biosphere.<br />\n<br />\nThe biosphere of Earth is dependent on atmospheric CO2 for its existence<br />\n<br />\nWhen CO2 from the atmosphere reacts with seawater, it immediately forms carbonic acid<br />\n(H2CO3), which in itself is unstable. This further dissociates to form bicarbonate and carbonate ions.Most \"CO2\" in the ocean exists neither as dissolved CO2(aq) nor as carbonate, CO3 (2-).<br />\n<br />\nInstead, most exists as the bicarbonate ion HCO3-.<br />\n<br />\nAdding CO\u2082 to sea water does NOT \u201cincrease acidity\u201d as the ocean is not acidic, it is basic (8.3 pH ). More importantly, adding CO\u2082 also does not make the ocean \u201cless alkaline\u201d either!<br />\n<br />\nSalt in the ocean allows the oceans to act as a SINK for CO2 without increasing acidity\u2014 rather it increases the buffering action and causes the ocean NOT to become more acidic OR alkaline \u2013 when dissolved CO2 increases OR decreases due to water temperature.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nTHE OCEANS ARE A SINK FOR CO2. That complexity is used to cope with pH changes among other adversities.<br />\n<br />\nReal science shows that shelled sea creatures benefit from increased CO2.Rothschild\u2019s propagandists claim carbon dioxide is an acid, and acid destroys carbonate in the ocean, while corals require carbonate.<br />\n<br />\nBut CO2 isn't just an acid; it is in equilibrium with carbonate. This means more CO2 entering the oceans results in more carbonate, not less.There are two scientific frauds involved.<br />\n<br />\nOne is to view CO2 only as an acid, as if it were equivalent to hydrochloric acid, while ignoring its equilibrium with carbonate. The other fraud is to ignore the huge buffering capacity of the oceans, which results in no detectable acidity from CO2 entering the oceans. .<br />\n<br />\nWhen oceans can hold no more CO2, they leave some in the atmosphere. As their temperatures increase, oceans release more CO2.<br />\n<br />\nOceans constantly increase in temperature between ice ages causing a constant increase in CO2 in the atmosphere.<br />\n<br />\nCalcium carbonate is a strong buffer at pH 8.1. At that pH, water strongly absorbs CO2, which is an acid being absorbed by an alkali.<br />\n<br />\nOceans are alkaline at pH 8.1. This means there are less than one tenth as many hydrogen ions in the oceans as in neutral water. Oceans would need to be ten times as acidic to be neutral..Oceans are alkaline, and due to large limestone sea beds, are incapable of becoming acidic- AN ACT OF GOD.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/chemical-hazards-on-chemical-tankers.html<br />\n<br />\nRothschild stooge, John Kerry urged big greenhouse gas emitters to follow the examples of China and the US, saying the two \"leaders of opposing camps\" in the climate talks have come to an agreement, which should send a message to other countries that the \"roadblocks\" to a Paris 2015 agreement can be removed.<br />\n<br />\nThe Zionists control the money , fuel and the food . The Union won the war, which remains the bloodiest in U.S. history.<br />\n<br />\nJew Rothschild fanned the sparks knowing that he would reap a golden harvest if he could divide the North and the South ideologically and then prod both sides into a protracted and bloody civil war.<br />\n<br />\nThe Civil War was planned in London by Rothschild who wanted two American democracies, each burdened with debt. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/WAAOlUdjLp0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/WAAOlUdjLp0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India more than 30%&nbsp; people diagnosed with type 2 diabetes&nbsp; have LADA. &nbsp;And most Indian doctors have even heard of\nLADA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The only way to\ndiagnose LADA is with a blood test for islet-cell antibodies<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LADA is a form of type\n1 diabetes that develops later into adulthood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LADA is an autoimmune\ndisease in which the body\u2019s immune system attacks and kills off insulin\nproducing cells.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LADA stands for Latent\nAutoimmune Diabetes of Adults. Latent means it comes on slowly - in this way\nit\u2019s similar to type 2 diabetes. Autoimmune is where the body attacks its own\ninsulin producing cells; similar to type 1 diabetes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LADA HAS ALWAYS BEEN\nMISDIAGNOSED AS TYPE 2 DIABETES IN INDIA, &nbsp;WHICH IS SUCH A DISGRACE .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India ignorant\ndoctors ( quota party/ donation party ) misdiagnose LADA as type 2 diabetes.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These idiots think that autoimmune type\ndiabetes can happen only to children or young adults.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India the trigger to\nLADA has been excessive consumption of sugary soft drinks and drinking toxic A1\nmilk of HUMPLESS Jersey cows.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is imperative\nthat&nbsp; LADA is diagnosed correctly.\nIf&nbsp; LADA is incorrectly diagnosed as type\n2 diabetes, it will lead to inappropriate treatment methods that could&nbsp; accelerate the loss of insulin producing\nability.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Type 1 diabetes is a\ncondition characterized by a lack of insulin due to autoimmune processes that\ndestroy the insulin-producing beta cells in the pancreas. Type 2 diabetes is\nprimarily associated with insulin resistance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Determining the\npresence of LADA is achieved by examining the presence of elevated levels of\npancreatic autoantibodies amongst patients who have recently been diagnosed\nwith diabetes but do not require insulin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A GAD Antibody test can\nmeasure the presence of these autoantibodies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These antibodies can\nidentify LADA, and also can predict the rate of progression towards insulin\ndependency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A Glutamic Acid\nDecarboxylase Autoantibodies test (GAD antibodies test) is used to help\ndiscover whether someone has either type 1 diabetes or Latent Autoimmune\nDiabetes of Adulthood (LADA).&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A GAD test\nis a blood test which measures whether the body is producing a type of antibody\nwhich destroys its own GAD cells.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Common antibody blood\ntests look for glutamic acid decarboxylase antibodies (GADA) \u2013 an antibody to\nan enzyme in beta cells; insulin autoantibodies (IAA) \u2013 antibodies that target\ninsulin; and insulinoma-associated-2 autoantibodies (IA-2A) \u2013 another antibody\nto a beta cell enzyme. If your test is positive for even one antibody, you have\nautoimmune diabetes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In diabetes, it\u2019s the\nbeta cells of the pancreas that are in low numbers. The beta cells are\nimportant because they make insulin.&nbsp;\nDegeneration of the beta cells is the main cause of type I diabetes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Serotonin has an\nessential function helping to repair the pancreas as a result of inflammation.\nLack of serotonin causes problems. Thus, in order to repair the pancreas, you\nneed to have adequate serotonin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Serotonin , can be\nsecured by a simple Surya Namaskar . .... Low doses of cannabis increases\nserotonin levels in the brain<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Insulin resistance (IR)\nis a condition that causes cells to reject the normal mechanism of insulin, a\nhormone that is produced by the pancreas and is fundamental to the regulation\nof glucose metabolism. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IR is associated with\ntype 2 diabetes; in type 1 diabetes, the body is unable to produce insulin,\nwhile in type 2, insulin production is unaffected but the cells are unable to\nprocess it. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When cells become\ninsulin-resistant, they are unable to absorb the glucose needed to supply them\nwith energy, and the unused glucose builds up in the bloodstream\u2013leading to\nhyperglycemia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Alpha cells secrete glucagon hormone that increases glucose in\nblood, while the beta cells secrete insulin, the hormone decreasing glucose\nconcentration.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alpha and beta cells communicate with each other, and the\ncentral role in this communication is played by cannabinoids \u2013 organic\ncompounds that occur in nature also in inflorescences of cannabis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diabetes 1 people tend\nto be thin or underweight.&nbsp; Diabetes 2\nfolks tend to be overweight or obese.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The primary cause of\nLADA is related to the high level of blood sugar as well as the islet failure\nof the body. The symptoms of the latter develop slowly. The\nsymptoms become prevalent when the patient reaches adulthood. That is why it is\noften incorrectly diagnosed as diabetes type 2 due to the age.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the west &nbsp;LADA occur on more than 53 % of patients\ndiagnosed with diabetes type 2.&nbsp; In India\nit is less as we consume Turmeric. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LADA &nbsp;occurs on the person who has no obesity.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;If a\nperson is diagnosed with diabetes type 2, but he or she is not obese, it is\nrecommended for them to take test like zinc transporter autoantibody (ZnT8),\ninsulinoma-associated (IA-2) autoantibody, islet cell autoantibody (ICA), and\nGlutamic acid decarboxylase autoantibody (GADA).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Type 1 diabetes is an\nautoimmune disease in which antibodies are made against the body\u2019s own\ninsulin-making cells (the beta cells) in the pancreas so that no insulin is\nbeing made.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People with type 1\ndiabetes need insulin as soon as they are diagnosed and people with type 2\ndiabetes rarely need insulin at all and have no autoantibodies in their\nbloodstreams.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another differentiator is\nthat people who are diagnosed with type 2 diabetes are usually considered\noverweight, while people with LADA are often at a healthy weight.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, unlike\ntype 1 diabetes, individuals with LADA may not require insulin straight away;\ninsulin requirements only become necessary months or years after diagnosis.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Also, individuals diagnosed with LADA are usually over the age of 30, compared\nto type 1 diabetes where most of the cases&nbsp;\noccur in chidren and young adults less than 20 years of age.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India iron fortified\nfoods have invaded the market, when it is NOT required. . The excess iron is\nunable to be removed from the body, leading to accumulation of iron over time,\nin organs such as the pancreas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consequently, the\namount of insulin produced by the damaged pancreas is affected.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chronic pancreatitis is\na condition where the pancreas becomes inflamed and painful over a long period\nof time. Diabetes is a common complication of chronic pancreatitis as the\namount of insulin produced by the inflamed pancreas is affected.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Around 75% of women\nwith PCOS present with type 2 diabetes due to insulin resistance, where the\ninsulin is not working effectively.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;The\nBeta cells of the pancreas are responsible for producing insulin which maintains\nglucose regulation. &nbsp;&nbsp;These Beta cells\ncan be damaged by both oxidative stress and attack by your own immune system. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">JUST TWO DECADES AGAO, &nbsp;INDIANS USED FRESH TURMERIC PASTE IN EVERY\nCURRY.&nbsp; THEY BOUGHT FRESH TURMERIC FROM\nTHE LOCAL VEGETABLE VENDOR. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">THOSE DAYS\nTHERE WERE VERY FEW MEDICAL SHOPS IN INDIA.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The destruction of beta\ncells is the main cause of Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus or Insulin Dependant\nDiabetes Mellitus (IDDM). &nbsp;&nbsp;The lack of\nbeta cells causes very little or no insulin circulating in the blood. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Type 2 Diabetes\nMellitus or Non-insulin dependant diabetes mellitus, there is insulin\nresistance where the ability to remove glucose from the blood is reduced by\nover 80%. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In type 2 diabetes,\nbeta cells undergo a slow degeneration and there can a reduction in beta cell\nmass thereby causing insufficient insulin to be produced.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The primary function of\na beta cell is to store and release insulin.&nbsp;\nInsulin is a hormone that brings about effects which reduce blood\nglucose concentration.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beta cells can\nrespond quickly to spikes in blood glucose concentrations by secreting some of\ntheir stored insulin while simultaneously producing more.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The longer the BETA\ncells had stayed in the sugary solution, the longer it took them to recover.\nThe damage might be irreversible after too much time in the glucose bath.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Insulin sensitivity\nimproved so that their beta cells don\u2019t have to work so hard.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga and curcumin, help\nbeta cells grow and heal</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The body\u2019s natural\nregeneration of beta cells may be hampered by high blood glucose levels (\ndrinking sugary Coke ) , which can damage newly regenerated beta cells<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People with LADA should\nbe aware of the signs of ketoacidosis and how to test for ketones if needed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/LwLWo6kUst4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/LwLWo6kUst4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During pregnancy, women\ncan get gestational diabetes, which resembles type 2 and usually disappears\nafter childbirth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again,&nbsp; type 1diabetes is an autoimmune disease in\nwhich the body's immune system kills off the beta cells in the pancreas, the\nmakers of insulin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whereas type 1 diabetes\nin children tends to develop quickly, sometimes within the space of days, LADA\ndevelops more slowly, sometimes over a period of years.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The slower onset of diabetes\nsymptoms being presented in people over 35 years may lead a doctor to initially\ndiagnose a case of LADA as type 2 diabetes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As LADA develops, a\nperson\u2019s ability to produce insulin will gradually decrease and this may lead\nto symptoms such as:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>A hard to quench thirst<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Needing to frequently\nurinate<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Blurred vision<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Tingling nerves</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GAD antibodies can help\nyour doctor determine if you have type 1 or 2 diabetes.&nbsp;&nbsp; Pancreas needs the enzyme glutamic acid\ndecarboxylase (GAD) to function normally. Antibodies that target this enzyme\nare called GAD antibodies.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An antibody is a protein that your immune system\nuses to attack foreign objects. Those foreign objects are often potentially\nharmful, such as viruses or bacteria.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-1HX28xRnx2w/WFDxs_6FrVI/AAAAAAABPrk/050pfLnJi8kBmBqgcfptgVHU1PSQc-bTwCLcB/s1600/world-diabetes-eeeday-43-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-1HX28xRnx2w/WFDxs_6FrVI/AAAAAAABPrk/050pfLnJi8kBmBqgcfptgVHU1PSQc-bTwCLcB/s640/world-diabetes-eeeday-43-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sometimes, the immune\nsystem makes antibodies that mistakenly attack normal, cells that aren\u2019t\nharmful. When that happens, it\u2019s called an autoimmune disorder.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ketones build up when\nthe body needs to break down fats and fatty acids to use as fuel. This is most\nlikely to occur when the body does not get enough sugar or carbohydrates.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This may be due to\ndiabetic ketoacidosis (DKA).&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; DKA is a\nlife-threatening problem that affects people with diabetes. It occurs when the\nbody cannot use sugar (glucose) as a fuel source because there is no insulin or\nnot enough insulin.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fat is used for\nfuel instead.&nbsp;&nbsp; Remember, untreated diabetic\nketoacidosis can be fatal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seek emergency care if:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your blood sugar level\nis consistently higher than 300 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL), or 16.7\nmillimoles per liter (mmol/L)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If for any reason the\nbody cannot get enough glucose for energy it will switch to using body fats,\nresulting in an increase in ketone production making them detectable in the\nblood and urine. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The human body normally\nruns on glucose that\u2019s produced when the body breaks down carbohydrates. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But when your body\ndoesn\u2019t have enough glucose or insulin to use the glucose, your body starts\nbreaking down fats for energy. &nbsp;You get\nunexplained &nbsp;sudden weight loss. &nbsp;You &nbsp;plump buttocks soon become like a sucked out\nmango.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ketones are byproducts\nof this breakdown. Those with type 1 diabetes are especially at risk for making\nketones. Ketones are the body\u2019s alternate way of fueling. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They build up when you:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>don\u2019t have enough\ninsulin<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>can\u2019t use the insulin\nyou have<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>aren\u2019t eating enough<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This may occur if you\naren\u2019t feeling well or you\u2019re trying to diet and you aren\u2019t eating enough.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your body receives\nsignals to release energy from fats when it:----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>doesn\u2019t have enough\ninsulin, which occurs in type 1 diabetes<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>can\u2019t use insulin\nproperly, which occurs in type 2 diabetes<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>can\u2019t use glucose\nproperly, which occurs in starvation<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>When these fats reach\nyour liver, it breaks them down into ketones.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The release of ketones\ncan become a cycle. Your body will continue to release energy from fats, and\nthe liver will continue to release ketones. This can cause your blood levels to\nbecome too acidic, which can be deadly. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you don\u2019t get\ntreatment for high ketone levels, DKA can occur. The most serious effects of\nDKA include:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>swelling in the brain<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>a loss of consciousness<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>diabetic coma<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>death</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a person has DKA,\nthe electrolyte levels tend to be low. Examples of electrolytes include\npotassium, sodium, and chloride.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Islet autoantibodies\nare chemicals that show up in the bloodstream when beta cells are under attack.\nAn antibody test can measure signs of trouble years before beta cells are\ntotally destroyed , giving you and your doctor the chance to plan a smart\nstrategy for taking care of LADA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Knowing you have LADA\ncould help your doctor choose early medications that can preserve beta cells\nlonger.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Insulin helps cells\nthroughout the body absorb glucose from the bloodstream and use it for energy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Type 1 diabetes results\nfrom the destruction of insulin producing pancreatic islet cells. The\npancreatic antibodies, however, do not cause type 1 diabetes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They simply\nhappen to be present in people at risk of developing type 1 diabetes. They can\nbe detected years before diabetes begins. Doctors can use the antibody levels\nin the blood to predict who will develop type 1 diabetes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Insulin controls how much glucose (a type of\nsugar) is passed from the blood into cells for conversion to energy. Lack of\ninsulin results in the inability to use glucose for energy or to control the\namount of sugar in the blood. Type 1 diabetes is a disorder characterized by\nabnormally high blood sugar levels<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In type 1 diabetes,\nspecialized cells in the pancreas called beta cells stop producing insulin<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Characteristics of LADA\ntend to include an intermediate level of beta cell dysfunction between those in\ntype 1 and type 2 diabetes, faster decline of C-peptide compared to type 2\ndiabetes, and a level of insulin resistance that is comparable to type 1 diabetes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">C-peptide BLOOD TEST is\nmeasured to tell the difference between insulin the body produces and insulin\nsomeone injects into their body. Someone with type 1 or type 2 diabetes may\nhave their C-peptide level measured to see if their body is still producing any\ninsulin.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;It may also be measured in cases of low blood sugar to see if the\nperson's body is producing too much insulin. A normal result 0.5 to 2.0\nnanograms per milliliter (ng/mL). People with type 2 diabetes and insulin\nresistance may have a high C-peptide level that is normal for them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">C-peptide is a product\nthat is created when the hormone insulin is produced and released into the\nbody. The insulin C-peptide test measures the amount of this product in the\nblood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">C-peptide level is\nbased on blood sugar level. C-peptide is a sign that your body is producing\ninsulin. A low level (or no C-peptide) indicates that your pancreas is\nproducing little or no insulin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">C-peptide levels are generally lower in LADA than\nin type 2 diabetes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">C-peptide is a peptide\ncomposed of 31 amino acids. It is released from the pancreatic beta-cells<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">C-peptide levels are\nsuppressed inType 1 diabetes mellitus<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In type 2 diabetes, the\nbody is resistant to the effects of insulin (insulin resistance) and it\ncompensates by producing and releasing more insulin, which can also lead to\nbeta cell damage.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Type 2 diabetics usually are treated with oral drugs to\nstimulate their body to make more insulin and/or to cause their cells to be\nmore sensitive to the insulin that is already being made. Eventually, because\nof the beta cell damage, type 2 diabetics may make very little insulin and\nrequire injections.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Any insulin that the body does make will be reflected in\nthe C-peptide level; therefore, the C-peptide test can be used to monitor beta\ncell activity and capability over time and to help a health practitioner\ndetermine when to begin insulin treatment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">C-peptide levels may be\nordered when a person has been newly diagnosed with type 1 diabetes as part of\nan evaluation of the person's \"residual beta cell function.\"&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Type 2 diabetes occurs\nwhen the pancreas fails to produce enough insulin to function properly, meaning\nthat glucose stays in the blood rather than being converted into energy.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In cystic fibrosis,\nmucus clogs the pancreas, and digestive enzymes are not able to get to the\nintestine. So food is not properly digested, particularly fats and proteins. A\nrelated symptom is large, greasy, smelly stools. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The thick, sticky mucus\ncauses scarring of the pancreas, preventing it from producing enough\ninsulin.&nbsp;&nbsp; More than&nbsp; 50% of adults with cystic fibrosis develop\ndiabetes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition to enzymes,\nthe pancreas also produces insulin, a hormone that helps control blood sugar.\nOver time, the abnormal buildup of enzymes starts to break down pancreatic\ntissue. This slows and may eventually stop insulin production, resulting in\ndiabetes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pancreatitis, an\ninflammation of the pancreas, &nbsp;results\nwhen thick mucus blocks the tube (duct) that leads from the pancreas to the\nbeginning of the small intestine (duodenum).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People develop diabetes\nmellitus because pancreatic duct blockages and digestive enzyme damage lead to\nfibrosis or scarring of the pancreas. This scarring impairs the endocrine\nfunctions of the pancreas, such as regulating insulin secretion. Impaired\nproduction of insulin results in diabetes mellitus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People with Cystic\nfibrosis-related diabetes (CFRD) do not respond to insulin in the right way\nlike people with type 2 diabetes, especially when sick, when taking steroid\nmedication, and when pregnant.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is referred to as being \"insulin\nresistant.\"&nbsp; Symptoms of CFRD are\nexcessive fatigue, weight loss and unexplained decline in lung function.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An oral glucose\ntolerance test (OGTT) is the best way to diagnose CFRD and is usually done in\nthe morning after an eight-hour fast.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The goal for treating CFRD is to keep\nblood sugar (glucose) at normal or near-normal levels. Doing so will help you\ngain weight, maintain muscle mass, feel better and have more energy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since foods with\ncarbohydrates turn into blood glucose when eaten, people with CFRD need to\ncount the carbohydrates in the foods they eat so they can give themselves the\nright amount of insulin<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga &nbsp;is good for lung function and can also improve\nyour body's response to insulin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/BhFpFiZumS0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/BhFpFiZumS0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8278975009030319779\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/12/arctic-ice-melt-and-methane-time-bomb.html?showComment=1481549498433#c5203970052293503998\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">December 12, 2016 at 7:01 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_243MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nJRD TATAs MOTHER WAS A FRENCH WOMAN SUZANNE BRIERE ( SOONI ) \u2026. CYRUS MISTRY IS AN IRISH CITIZEN\u2026. HIS MOTHER PATSY IS IRISH\u2026 Noel Tata's mother ( Ratan Tata's step-mother ) is Simone Dunoyer -a Frenchwoman. \u2026.Only idiots will set up business in Britain, where people want money without working for it\u2026. The John Bull is very conscious of his rights and pension demands\u2026.. Tata Steel was awarded the '2015 World's Most Ethical Company' award under the Metals category by the Ethisphere Institute. \u2026\u2026.This was the third time, that Tata Steel won this award\u2026 BRAAAAYYYYYYYYY!...... SOMETIMES TO GET SUCH AN AWARD , YOU HAVE TO BECOME A CH0OT AND SIT ON CHANNE KA JHAAD\u2026\u2026 Tata Steel acquired the steel giant Corus in 2007\u2026\u2026To fend off a Brazilian rival, Companhia Sider\u00fargica Nacional (CSN) (this was a Rothschild signature trick for which only their ex-opium drug running agents fall )\u2026.. Tata had to pay a 70% premium over the stock price\u2026\u2026 Mind you, Jew Rothschild was brought in to advise Tata Steel\u2014 in addition to ABN Amro and Deutsche Bank\u2014late in the game after the Brazilian company CSN upped the stakes ( a game for CHO0TS )\u2026\u2026.. On 30/31 January an auction was held by the Panel for Corus's shares, with Tata outbidding CSN at \u00a36.08 vs \u00a36.03 per share\u2026\u2026.. CSN's bid had been supported by Goldman Sachs whilst Tata's was supported by ABN Amro, Rothschilds, and Deutsche Bank\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.. SAAB ROTHSCHILD KI LEELA THA, WITH AN EX \u2013OPIUM BUSINESS PARTNER !...... Tata paid only $4bn (\u00a32.8bn) of the estimated $14bn final price out of its own funds \u2013 the rest was borrowed, mainly from Indian public sector banks. Corus steel was acquired by Tata of India in 2007, and renamed Tata Steel Europe in September 2010\u2026\u2026. In September 2010, Corus announced that it was changing its name to Tata Steel Europe and adopting the Tata logo\u2026\u2026\u2026 WE THE PEOPLE OF INDIA WANT TO KNOW WHY ARUN JAITLEY AND MODI IS ONLY AFTER VIJAYA MALLYA\u2026\u2026. WHAT ABOUT THE LOANS TAKEN BY TATA AND OTHERS ?....... Even if Tata steel sells , the humongous GBP 15 billion British Steel Pension Scheme, a part of Tata Steel UK, has 130,000 members and will not be taken over by the new buyer\u2026.. This means the liability stays with Tata Steel\u2026\u2026. Do you have any idea how much is 15 BILLION POUNDS ? \u2026\u2026. Are these PATHETIC meat and potato Limey steel workers lords and dukes?....... Why were Indian taxpayer-funded Public sector banks so willing to lend to TATA to buy up an overpriced and defunct CORUS steel , even as they denied loans to Indian farmers committing suicide and small-scale cottage industries?........ Repayment of those loans was supposed to be made out of the profits of Tata Steel Europe. But those profits never came\u2026. text-decoration: none;\">December 13, 2016 at 9:55 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_41MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttp://deshgujarat.com/2016/12/09/pm-narendra-modi-to-inaugurate-new-amul-cheese-factory-and-launch-amul-deshi-a2-cow-milk-at-banas-dairy-in-gujarat-tomorrow/<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nAhmedabad: Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi will inaugurate the new Amul Cheese factory at Banas dairy on 10th December and will also launch \u00c1mul Deshi A2 Cow Milk on the same day.<br />\n<br />\nThe Prime Minister will also launch \u2018Amul Deshi\u2019 A2 Cow Milk, which Amul Federation will market in Ahmedabad with an objective of targeting niche market consisting of conscious consumers seeking pure cow milk from Indigenous cow breeds. The product will be unveiled by Prime Minister, Sh. Narendra Modi at inauguration function of Banas Dairy\u2019s New Cheese Plant at Deesa, Banaskantha, Guajarat.<br />\n<br />\nManaging Director of GCMMF said in a press statement that \u201cThis pure A2 cow milk will be procured from Indigenous cows and made available in 50 0ml PET bottles through Amul Parlours of Ahmedabad City exclusively. This product aims to target consumers who require pure cow milk from Indigenous cow breeds. We aim to sell 10000 LPD within 1 month\u201d.<br />\n<br />\nAmul would be marketing this product \u201cAmul Deshi\u201d cow milk priced at Rs. 35.00 per 500ml PET bottle and aims to cover all Amul Parlours within 1 month of launch. Gujarat Co-operative Milk Marketing Federation, India\u2019s largest food products marketing organization is a cooperative federation of 36 lakh milk producers affiliated to 18000 village cooperative societies handle 170 lakh litres of milk every day and sells 120 Lakh Liters per Day of Pouch Milk across India.</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_41BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2474303494347826826\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_168M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/12/donald-trump-for-president-part-9-capt.html?showComment=1481347018830#c2474303494347826826\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">December 10, 2016 at 10:46 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_168MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSOMEONE ASKED ME -- WHY IS THE BEEHIVE A PERFECT HEXAGON ?<br />\n<br />\nWELL IT IS THE EFFECT OF SHABDA BRAHMAN --A TRUTH OF LIFE.<br />\n<br />\nTHE BEEHIVE IS MADE BY LONGITUDINAL SOUND WAVES<br />\n<br />\nTHE BENZENE RING IS A HEXAGON-- SNOW FLAKE IS A HEXAGON<br />\n<br />\nWHEN SHIVA AND SHAKTI MERGES ( THIRD SANKHYA TEMPLATE OF HINDUISM ) THE RESULT IS A SIX POINTED STAR WHOSE MANDALA IS A HEXAGON<br />\n<br />\nTHE SATURN PROBE CASSINI FOUND A HUGE HEXAGON ON THE NORTH POLE OF SATURN<br />\n<br />\nOn earth, the polar vortex and the jet stream that surrounds it have a wonky shape. This is because the earth has mountains, oceans, and all sorts of other features that affect the path of wind and weather.<br />\n<br />\nSaturn is just a ball of gas, so there's nothing to disturb the polar vortex and its jet stream.<br />\n<br />\nHEXAGON HOLDS GOOD AT MICRO AND MACRO SCALE<br />\n<br />\nThe graphite ring is a hexagon.. Graphite ( carbon ) consists of a layered structure, made of hexagonal rings of carbon (like benzene). Each layer is like chicken wire. This is why graphite is used as a resilient lubricant and in pencils.<br />\n<br />\nPure carbon is diamond. In this case, there is a three dimensional bonding instead of this layered structure. That is why diamond is not used for writing; in fact , it is the hardest material on earth.<br />\n<br />\nGraphene is an extremely strong material, which consists of a single layer of graphite!<br />\n<br />\nSaturn's hexagon is more than the diameter of the earth.. Saturn's south pole does not have a hexagon, however, it does have a vortex, and there is also a vortex inside the northern hexagon.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: purple;\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturn's_hexagon#/media/File:Colorful_Hexagon.gif</span><br />\n<br />\nwith earth's arctic ice melting (related to methane ), the polar vortex is almost reaching the equator --and this is not a good thing.<br />\n<br />\nThere are two polar vortices in the Earth's atmosphere, which overlie the North, and South Poles. Each polar vortex is a persistent, large-scale, low pressure zone that rotates counter-clockwise at the North Pole (called a cyclone), and clockwise at the South Pole.<br />\n<br />\nTRUMP HAS TAKEN AN IDIOT IN HIS TEAM JEFF SESSIONS WHO SUPPORTS FRACKING<br />\n<br />\nThe volume transport of the Gulf Stream has increased by three times since the past 50 years due to the rising atmospheric pressure difference set up between the polluted, methane greenhouse gas rich air above North America and the marine Atlantic air.<br />\n<br />\nThe increasingly heated Gulf Stream, with its associated high winds and energy-rich weather systems, flows NE to Europe where it recently pummelled Great Britain and Europe with catastrophic storms.<br />\n<br />\nOther branches of the Gulf Stream then enter the Arctic and heat up the Arctic methane hydrate seals on subsea and deep high-pressure mantle methane reservoirs below the Eurasian Basin-Laptev Sea transition.<br />\n<br />\nThis is releasing increasing amounts of methane into the atmosphere producing anomalous temperatures, greater than 20\u00b0C above average<br />\n<br />\nARCTIC METHANE IS A TIME BOMB<br />\n<br />\nINDIA HAS AN ARCTIC STATION-- THEY HAVE NO PROJECT IN HAND EXCEPT RELAXING ON THEIR ASSES , DRINKING AND WATCHING POLAR BEARS<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/methane-time-bomb-arctic-ice-meltdown.html</span><br />\n<br />\nThe whole northern hemisphere is now covered by a thickening atmospheric methane veil that is spreading southwards at about 1 km a day and it already totally envelopes the United States.<br />\n<br />\nIf the GLOBAL WARMING POTENTIAL ( GWP ) is 1 for Carbon Dioxide, it is 104 for Methane over a 20 year period.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/most-potent-greenhouse-gases-nitrous.html</span><br />\n<br />\nA giant hole in the equatorial ozone layer has also been discovered in the west Pacific, which acts like an elevator transferring methane from lower altitudes to the stratosphere, where it already forms a dense equatorial global warming stratospheric band that is spreading into the Polar regions.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_168BR\"
